reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Sustained Media Advocacy on National Climate Change Policy of Nigeria

description.narrative: Experienced academics, Civil Society Practitioners and Professionals on health, social and environmental matters were paired in a group of two to discuss topical issues around oil theft, artisanal refining of crude and environmental education for youths and children in the Niger Delta. The approach of the discussions was designed to instigate behavioural change and seeking audience expertise on issues around oil theft. The discussions were moderated by a presenter who ensured that, conversations stayed on track to ensure right messages were being passed to the listening audience.

owner-org.narrative: Activity 3.4 Sustained Media Advocacy on National Climate Change Policy

activity-date.narrative: Activity took place across states of the Niger Delta.

organisation.narrative: All inquiries should be directed to the National Coordinator of NACGOND

recipient-country.narrative: Strong media activities were targeted at getting strategic climate change messages across to audience using different channels.

sector.narrative: Policy makers, members of the legislature, youth groups, women groups, community opinion leaders were targeted in this activity.

title.narrative: Though radio discussions are difficult to measure immediate outcomes, feedback channels show that, the radio live appearance has become a channel through which listening audience on environmental issues around the Niger Delta.
Most audience rely on NACGOND media outreach for recent environmental updates on issues in the Niger Delta.
